column4: I have, can someone help me with my Wireless connection? I can't connect to it, using Ubuntu 9.04 and Wireless Card: RTL8185
I have already tried everything I found and nothing seems to work.
When I assign an IP to my computer, it says it cannot connect to the access point.
When I configure to use DHCP Server, it says it can't assign IP address.
Yes HughCOCK, WPA2.
You can see the router configuration here: http://img30.imageshack.us/img30/8365/routern.png
The red text is because i hided the password.
Ok HughCOCK, any website where I can learn how to use wpa_supplicant?
| wicd works better with wap/2
already tried and it won't connect :/
| sometimes you have to edit the settings in wicd-client -n and point it 2 the right interface
| you also need to comment out all your hardware interface in /etc/network/interfaces for wicd to work properly
| wicd-client -n and look for options on the menu bar
all I have in my /etc/network/interfeaces is: "auto lo" and "iface lo inet loopback" (with no ").
| if you really like to edit wpa manually. www.ubuntuguide.org and look for Feisty
first i'm gonna do what you told me, comment those lines and then the wicd-client -n
| don't forget to reload /etc/init.d/networking restart .... after commenting
| does this give you any output ... sudo iwconfig and sudo iwlist <wifi nic> scan
what do I put in <wifi nic>?
btw, sudo iwconfig response: http://www.nomorepasting.com/getpaste.php?pasteid=28919
| what interface shows up with wifi related output when u sudo iwconfig
here is the sudo iwlist wlan0 scan: http://www.nomorepasting.com/getpaste.php?pasteid=28921
as I can see, i want to connect to Cell 01.
| just go to www.ubuntuguide.org and try their steps if none of my suggestion works
